title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, there should be a confirmation to check if the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. Currently, some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files, which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: Currently, when a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure and points the output folder to a bin directory, there is no confirmation or check if the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
EB: After creating a new project, there should be a confirmation or check to ensure that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt if necessary.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new project for an existing directory structure.
2. Point the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files.
3. Verify that there is no confirmation or check if the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.

Expected result:
After creating the project, there should be a confirmation or check to ensure that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt if necessary.
